abstract: Also, David Pogue gets lost as he test drives the new Apple maps for the iPhone 5, and J.K. Rowling’s novel for adults is reviewed by Michiko Kakutani.
snippet: Also, David Pogue gets lost as he test drives the new Apple maps for the iPhone 5, and J.K. Rowling’s novel for adults is reviewed by Michiko Kakutani.
lead_paragraph: The debacle of an ending to “Monday Night Football” on ESPN apparently was enough to propel a settlement Wednesday night to the lockout of N.F.L. referees, Judy Battista reported. Under the eight-year labor deal, pensions will remain in place for current officials through the 2016 season; new officials will get a 401(k) instead. The average official’s salary will rise to $173,000 in 2013 from $149,000 in 2011.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: N.F.L. Quickly Reverses on Referees, and Satire Gone Wild
